titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1406) to amend the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 to provide compensatory time for employees in the private sector.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 113-51, by Ms. Foxx.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 1406 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. Measure will be considered read. A specified amendment is in order.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 22.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 198.

POSTPONED PROCEEDINGS - At the conclusion of debate on H.Res. 198, the Chair put the question on ordering the previous question on H.Res. 198 and by voice vote announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Polis demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings on ordering the previous question on H.Res. 198 until later in the legislative day.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 230 - 198 (Roll no. 132).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 228 - 199 (Roll no. 133).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 5/6/2013--Introduced. Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1406) to amend the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 to provide compensatory time for employees in the private sector.
